348.article_body: Former Karnataka CM and Leader of Opposition Siddaramaiah said that he does not have any objections to teaching the Bhagavad Gita in schools. "Children are taught Bhagavad Gita, Ramayana and Mahabharata at home as well. Moral education should be taught to children," Siddaramaiah added. "The country believes in a pluralistic society and we believe in harmony and tolerance," he stated.

349.title: Preity Zinta shares pics from her first Holi in US since becoming mother
349.article_body: Actress and Punjab Kings owner Preity Zinta took to Instagram to share pictures from her first Holi since becoming mother. She wrote, "Even though the world isn't perfect right now & there is little to celebrate...We couldn't let...Holi go by without celebrating it as new parents. Our first big desi celebration since the pandemic & since the babies were born."

350.title: 19-yr-old driver of SUV that hit and killed infant in Hyderabad arrested
350.article_body: A 19-year-old man, Syed Afnan Ahmed, has been arrested after the SUV he was driving, hit and killed an infant in Hyderabad on March 17. Police said that the SUV had rammed into three street vendors and the two infants who were in their mothers' laps had fallen down. One of them was later declared dead at Apollo hospital.

351.title: How can I be an outsider if PM can contest from Varanasi: Sinha
351.article_body: TMC candidate for Asansol Shatrughan Sinha on Sunday questioned the BJP's allegation that he is an "outsider from Bihar", saying, "How can I be an outsider if PM Narendra Modi who comes from Gujarat [can] contest from Kashi (Varanasi)." Furthermore, he praised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and called her a "historic leader in true sense and a tigress".

352.title: Mother delayed death to help us be accustomed to emptiness: KPAC Lalitha's son
352.article_body: Late actress KPAC Lalitha's son Sidharth Bharathan said that he feels his mother delayed her own death to help them get accustomed to the emptiness she would leave behind. "She did not leave us at once...she stopped talking, stopped responding...stayed like that for a while. Towards the end, she lost her memory. She did not respond to anything," Sidharth added.

353.title: Cong doesn't know many of its MLAs will join BJP: Sarma on RS polls
353.article_body: Ahead of Rajya Sabha elections for two seats in Assam, state CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday said that "Congress doesn't know that many of their MLAs are going to join the BJP." He added that "candidates are not bound to follow the whip issued in the party" in these polls. "We'll manage to get both the seats," he asserted.

354.title: India reports 1,549 new COVID-19 cases, 31 deaths; active cases at 25,106
354.article_body: India has reported 1,549 new COVID-19 cases and 31 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 31 deaths, 11 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 20 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,510, and the active cases declined to 25,106.

355.title: Pune records 29 new COVID-19 infections, active cases drop below 500
355.article_body: The Pune district recorded 29 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday including four in Pune rural and 19 in Pune city. The number of active cases in the district dropped below 500, standing at 420. No deaths were registered during this period, keeping the total fatality count at 20,513. Over 1.75 crore vaccine doses have been administered so far.

356.title: Taylor Fritz ends Nadal's 20-match winning streak to win Indian Wells title
356.article_body: American player Taylor Fritz ended 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal's 20-match winning streak to win the BNP Paribas Open. Fritz, who had an injured ankle, defeated Nadal 6-3, 7-6 (7-5) to claim his career's second ATP Tour trophy. "This is just one of those childhood dreams you just think would never come true," said Fritz.

357.title: Akshaye Khanna deserves lot of credit for Race's success; he's gifted: Saif
357.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan, who worked with actor Akshaye Khanna in 'Race', praised his performance in the film. Speaking about Akshaye, Saif said, "Akshaye deserves a lot of credit for making 'Race' what it is by performing his role in such a special way." "He is...a gifted actor and he had a lot of fun with that role," Saif added.

358.title: Hyd body urge to speak against domestic violence, say 'help will arrive'
358.article_body: The Women and Children Safety Wing of Cyberabad in Hyderabad took to Twitter to share a post about domestic violence and urged people to speak about it. The safety wing also provided number for victims to call on. "Report crimes against women and help will arrive soon," the post read. It also said, "Don't keep your lips sealed shut."

359.title: 4 arrested as interstate drugs racket busted in Hyd, heroin seized
359.article_body: An interstate drugs racket was busted by a Special Operation Team of the Hyderabad Police. The official Twitter handle of Rachakonda Police confirmed that four people were arrested by officers following the raid. The force seized 16 grams of heroin (brown sugar), which had been transported from West Bengal to Hyderabad, cash and five mobile phones from their possession.

360.title: Son of shop owner and worker fall into basement of Delhi factory, suffocate to death
360.article_body: Two men suffocated to death after they slipped on makeshift stairs and fell into a basement filled with wooden logs at a cycle rickshaw assembling factory in Delhi. Police said the logs were sprayed with pesticide, used to prevent foliage and insect growth on wood, which led to the deaths. The stairs were made with loose planks, police added.

361.title: Body of 21-year-old Indian student killed in Ukraine arrives in Bengaluru
361.article_body: The body of the 21-year-old Indian student who was killed in Russian shelling in war-torn Ukraine arrived in Bengaluru in the early hours of Monday. Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who was studying at the Kharkiv National Medical University, died on March 1. Gyanagoudar's family members and Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai were present at Bengaluru airport to receive the body.

362.title: Biden to travel to Ukraine's neighbour Poland over Russian invasion
362.article_body: US President Joe Biden will travel to Poland on Friday to meet President Andrzej Duda for discussions over Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the White House has said. "The President will discuss how the US, alongside our Allies and partners, is responding to the humanitarian and human rights crisis that Russia's unjustified and unprovoked war on Ukraine has created," it said.

363.title: When is a Test match pitch rated 'below average'?
363.article_body:
As per ICC, a pitch is rated 'below average' when it has either very little carry and/or bounce and/or more than occasional seam movement, or occasional variable (but not excessive or dangerous) bounce and/or occasional variable carry. "A pitch...with...these features...cannot be rated in higher category regardless
of the amount of turn it displays at any stage," the rule further states.

364.title: Railways to resume seasonal pass service on Pune-Mumbai route
364.article_body: The Central Railway will resume the seasonal pass and unreserved passenger services on the Pune-Mumbai route from March 22, said authorities. The services will be made available for Deccan Queen Express, Intercity Express, Indrayani Express, Deccan Express and Sinhagad Express trains. Notably, the services had been stopped since March 2020 owing to COVID-19 pandemic.

365.title: B'luru customs seize antique bronze statue from shipment; 1 held
365.article_body: Bengaluru Airport and Air Cargo Commissionerate's Customs Intelligence Unit officials on Sunday intercepted a shipment containing an antique bronze statue of Lord Vishnu, believed to be over a hundred years old. The exporter, who was attempting to send it to Malaysia, has been arrested. The statue was certified by a nominee authorised by the Director General, Archaeological Survey of India.

366.title: 3 threaten man out on walk, force him to transfer ₹76,000 in Pune
366.article_body: An FIR has been filed after three persons allegedly threatened to kill a man and his female friend and forced the man to digitally transfer ₹76,000 in Pune. The duo had been out on a walk on Pashan Hill and was sitting on a rock when the accused approached them, according to the FIR. The incident took place on Friday.

367.title: Every Indian must watch 'The Kashmir Files': Aamir Khan
367.article_body: Aamir Khan has said every Indian must watch 'The Kashmir Files'. "What happened to Kashmiri Pandits is a matter of great sorrow. Such a film must be watched by all Indians so...they can remember what occurred," he said. "This film has touched...emotions of all people who believe in humanity and that is what is so beautiful about it," stated Aamir.

368.title: Dad never let me use family name privilege: Mithun's son
368.article_body: Actor Mithun Chakraborty's son Mimoh Chakraborty said that his father never let him use the "privilege of family name" and that he is facing his own demons. "He [Mithun] told me that if I wanted something I have to earn it," Mimoh said, adding that Mithun's work is "unlimited" and that "there is no stopping him".

369.title: 30 arrested after police raid bar in Mumbai's Malad; 25 women rescued
369.article_body: Thirty persons were arrested and 25 women were rescued after Mumbai Police's Crime Branch raided a bar in the city's Malad area. "A decoy customer found women dancing in violation of norms, following which the raid was carried out," a police officer said. The 30 arrested persons include customers, waiters and other staff of the eatery-cum-bar, according to the officer.

370.title: 1,000 Olive Ridley turtle hatchlings released on Visakhapatnam beach
370.article_body: As many as 1,000 hatchlings of Olive Ridley turtles were released into the sea at Visakhapatnam's RK Beach on Sunday. District collector Mallikarjuna and forest officials reportedly released the endangered turtles into the water. District Forest Officer Anant Shankar said multiple hatcheries have been set up by their team to protect the rare turtles from being eaten by other animals.

371.title: Elon Musk among witnesses in Johnny Depp & Amber Heard's court case
371.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has been included in list of witnesses slated to testify in a defamation lawsuit filed by Johnny Depp against his ex-wife Amber Heard. Depp has alleged that Heard had an extra-marital affair with Musk and James Franco while they were married. Both Musk and Franco are scheduled to testify virtually during the trial next month.

372.title: Paris taxi driver files complaint against Tesla for crash that killed 1
372.article_body: A Paris taxi driver has filed a legal complaint against Tesla after his Tesla Model 3 crashed in December, killing one person. The driver told police that the car accelerated on its own and that he was unable to activate the brakes. Earlier, the French government while quoting Tesla said there was no immediate indication of a technical fault.

373.title: 2 Mumbai metro corridors likely to become operational by mid-April
373.article_body: The Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) said the Dahisar East-DN Nagar and Dahisar East-Andheri East metro corridors will likely get safety clearance by March-end. Around two to three days of safety inspection is pending, officials said. They added that after receiving the safety clearance certificates, the two corridors are likely to become operational by mid-April.

374.title: Kashmiri pandits' pain too tragic to be manipulated: Cong MP Gogoi
374.article_body: Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi on Sunday took to Twitter to ask whether an Indian mode of healing and reconciliation in Kashmir could be developed. He added, "The pain and anguish of Kashmiri Pandits are too real and tragic to be...ignored or...manipulated. People of J&K deserve peace, justice and fraternity." His comments came amid the ongoing controversy around 'The Kashmir Files'.

375.title: Multipurpose women's co-op societies to start in all K'taka taluks
375.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday announced that the multipurpose women's cooperative societies will be started in every taluk of the state. The societies are understood to have 90% share capital from the state government. CM Bommai said the "government has decided to establish a milk producers bank to ensure that the profit goes to milk producers".

376.title: Man tries to enter Hindon air base illegally, arrested by IAF
376.article_body: A man has been apprehended by Indian Air Force officials after he allegedly attempted to get inside the force's Hindon airbase near Delhi in an unauthorised manner. The incident is said to have taken place in the city on Sunday. An IAF official informed that the accused has been handed over to local police for further action following initial interrogation.

377.title: AAP's Gopal Rai inaugurates new party office in Chhattisgarh
377.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Gopal Rai inaugurated a new party office in Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Sunday. "We've been receiving...calls from...people of the state to join the party," said Rai who'll be participating in 'Vijay Yatra' in the capital on Monday to mark AAP's victory in Punjab. The party is reportedly planning to contest the Chhattisgarh assembly elections next year.

378.title: Coimbatore school teacher runs first cactus museum in Tamil Nadu
378.article_body: A school teacher in Coimbatore is reportedly running the first cactus museum in Tamil Nadu. The teacher, identified as Sheemalatha, said the museum has over a thousand varieties of the plant. She added, "I've been growing cactus since 2006 to create awareness among people who think cactus resembles negativity."  Pictures from the place show students examining the plant's different varieties.

379.title: Remove genitalia models from family planning kits, Maha govt urged
379.article_body: Political parties and activists in Maharashtra's Buldhana district have urged state government to remove "embarrassing" rubber models of male and female reproductive organs from family planning counselling kits. "How will Asha workers explain about it?" Prashant Dikkar of Swabhimani Shetkari Sanghatana said. Meanwhile, a social worker claimed Asha workers had approached her saying they feel shy.

380.title: They're never flustered: Cummins on Kohli, Babar, Root, Williamson
380.article_body: Commenting on similarities between top batters in the world including Virat Kohli, Kane Williamson, Joe Root and Babar Azam, Australia Test captain Pat Cummins said they're "never flustered" and are happy to bat for long periods of time. "All know their game incredibly well...if there's an opportunity, they get off the mark pretty quickly, start accumulating...runs really quickly," he stated.

381.title: Federer is guitar solo, Nadal, Serena are like heavy metal: Musician Wentz
381.article_body: Asked to describe musical comparisons of playing styles of Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Serena Williams, musician Pete Wentz said Federer is a "guitar solo" and for Nadal and Serena their game resembles "heavy metal". He added, "When you see Federer play, you're seeing something that's so incredibly beautiful." Wentz is bassist and lyricist for rock band Fall Out Boy.

382.title: State govt hoarded 'tuvar dal', over 70 lakh people affected: Cong
382.article_body: The Gujarat government, along with black marketers, has hoarded 'tuvar dal' supply for the past four months, the Congress said on Sunday. Gujarat Pradesh Congress Committee (GPCC) spokesperson Manish Doshi accused the state government of not providing 'tuvar dal' to over 70.81 lakh beneficiaries, adding that several claims about distributing food grains at cheaper rates were made in the past.

383.title: Nashik Police to summon Rajasthan CM's son in cheating case
383.article_body: Nashik Police has said that it'll summon 14 accused in a cheating case, including Rajasthan’s Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot's son Vaibhav Gehlot, for questioning this week. This comes after a complaint was filed by a Nashik-based businessman on March 17 who claimed that he was lured into investing in a company with which Vaibhav was allegedly affiliated.

384.title: UP govt creates 5,000 new police posts across units like ATS & STF
384.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government has announced the creation of 5,000 new posts across several units of the police, including the Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) and Special Task Force (STF). The UP Police is also set to get a specialised team to keep an eye on drone activities to boost security in the state, according to reports.

385.title: Lakshya Sen wins silver at All England Open, loses to world no. 1 Axelsen in final
385.article_body: India's 20-year-old shuttler Lakshya Sen won the silver medal at All England Open Badminton Championships 2022, bagging India's first medal in men's singles in the tournament in 21 years. World number one men's player Viktor Axelsen of Denmark defeated Lakshya with a scoreline of 21-10, 21-15 to win his second All England Open title.

386.title: Drunk driver, conductor abandon bus with passengers in Guj; booked
386.article_body: A driver and a conductor, who abandoned a passenger-filled state transport bus in Gujarat's Ahmedabad after causing an accident while in an inebriated state on Sunday, have been booked under the Prohibition Act. The pair are, however, yet to be identified. Police said that they recovered six bottles of illicit Indian Made Foreign Liquor 'whisky' from the driver’s cabin.

387.title: 10,000 people attend 'anti-war' concert in Berlin amid Ukraine crisis
387.article_body: Around 10,000 people attended an 'anti-war' concert in Berlin on Sunday to express solidarity with Ukraine, police said. The concert took place near Brandenburg Gate, which was symbol of divided Germany during Cold War, with people waving Ukrainian flags and holding anti-invasion banners. The performers included Natalia Klitschko, a Ukrainian singer who's married to Kyiv's Mayor Vitali Klitschko.

388.title: Reigning world champion Yamaguchi wins maiden All England title
388.article_body: Reigning world champion Akane Yamaguchi won her maiden All England Championships women's singles title in Birmingham on Sunday. The 24-year-old second seed defeated fourth seed An Seyoung 21-15, 21-15 of Korea in 44 minutes. Yamaguchi had reached the final in 2018 but lost to Tai Tzu Ying. It's the Japanese shuttler's 18th career and a ninth world tour title.

389.title: PayPal expands services for Ukrainian users, waives transaction fees
389.article_body: PayPal said it is expanding services in Ukraine and Ukrainians will now be able to send and receive money from friends and family. Earlier, PayPal users in Ukraine could only send money internationally from their accounts and not receive it. PayPal is also waiving transaction fees for remittances to Ukrainian accounts.

390.title: Zelenskyy questions lack of 'powerful' Israeli sanctions on Russia
390.article_body: During his address to the Israeli Parliament, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Why Israel hasn't imposed powerful sanctions on Russia or isn't putting pressure on Russian business." He also questioned Israel's reluctance to sell the Iron Dome system to Ukraine. "Everybody knows that your missile defence systems are the best...and that you can definitely help...save...lives," he said.

391.title: PM Modi clearly used his contacts to call for end of war: Australia
391.article_body: Australian High Commissioner to India Barry O'Farrell said the Quad nations of Australia, Japan and the US have accepted India's stand on the Russia-Ukraine conflict. "It's clear from the comments of...Prime Minister Narendra Modi...that he has used his contacts to call for the end of the conflict and no country will be unhappy with that," said O'Farrell.

392.title: Hyderabad FC clinch their maiden ISL title after defeating Kerala Blasters on penalties
392.article_body: Hyderabad FC defeated Kerala Blasters 3-1 on penalties in final to win their maiden Indian Super League (ISL) title. Rahul KP scored for Kerala Blasters in 68th minute before Hyderabad FC's Sahil Tavora equalised in 88th minute as the match went to extra time and then penalties. Kerala Blasters have now lost all of their three finals in ISL.

393.title: Govt plans to merge BBNL and BSNL this month: BSNL chief
393.article_body: Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) Chairman and MD PK Purwar said the government has decided to merge BSNL and Bharat Broadband Nigam Limited (BBNL) this month. He added that the government has given BSNL an opportunity to turnaround their losses. With the proposed merger, BSNL will get 5.67 lakh kilometre of optical fibre network laid across 1.85 lakh village panchayats.

394.title: 'Donate 'The Kashmir Files' profits for Brahmin kids,' says MP IAS officer
394.article_body: MP Public Works Department's Deputy Secretary Niyaz Khan has triggered a controversy by saying that all the earnings of 'The Kashmir Files' must be donated for Brahmin children's education and construction of homes for them in Kashmir. "It will be a great charity," said Khan in a now-viral tweet. MP minister Vishwas Sarang said he'll seek action against Khan.

395.title: K'taka CM thanks PM for efforts to bring Naveen's body from Ukraine
395.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi to thank him for his efforts in bringing back the mortal remains of Naveen Shekharappa, who was killed in the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv. The fourth-year medical student from Karnataka was killed in a shelling attack. His mortal remains will reach Bengaluru on March 21.

396.title: Attempts being made to divide the country once again: Mehbooba
396.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Sunday said that attempts are being made to divide the country once again on communal lines. "If we allow this religious division to happen, the sacrifice of freedom fighters like Bhagat Singh will go in vain. Therefore, do not allow Gandhi to die once again," she further said.

397.title: 42-year-old man abducts, rapes 8-year-old girl in Nagpur; arrested
397.article_body: A 42-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a mentally unwell eight-year-old girl in Nagpur's  Imamwada area on Sunday, police said. The accused, who runs a juice stall in the locality, allegedly abducted the girl and raped her at his house, police added. The victim later narrated the ordeal to her sister, following which a police complaint was registered.

398.title: US Indo-Pacific strategy as dangerous as NATO expansion in Europe: China
398.article_body: China's Vice Foreign Minister Le Yucheng on Saturday said that the US' Indo-Pacific strategy and creation of groups such as Quad are as "dangerous" as NATO's eastward expansion in Europe. "The Ukraine crisis...provides a mirror for us to observe the situation in the Asia-Pacific," he added. Notably, Chinese officials have blamed NATO's potential expansion for triggering the crisis in Ukraine.

399.title: Vinod Kapri shares clip of 19-yr-old man running in Noida at midnight, video viral
399.article_body: Filmmaker Vinod Kapri has shared a video of a 19-year-old man running in Noida at midnight. In the clip, Kapri offered Pradeep Mehra a lift, which he refused and said he runs 10 km daily, from his job in Sector 16 to his home in Barola. Refusing dinner with Kapri, Mehra said his brother back home will be left hungry.

400.title: Leclerc wins F1 2022 season-opening race, Max Verstappen fails to finish
400.article_body: Ferrari driver Charles Leclerc won the Bahrain Grand Prix, the first race of Formula One 2022 season, with his teammate Carlos Sainz finishing second. Meanwhile, Formule One 2021 champion Max Verstappen failed to finish the race due to a mechanical issue with his car. Seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton finished third after Sergio Perez spun in the last lap.
